a.style: font-family:"Playfair Display", Georgia, "Times New Roman", serif

text.tspan: Poverty is measured as the share of the population living on less than 3.20 international-$ per day.
Share of population below $3.20 per day
Source: Data compiled from multiple sources by World Bank, PovCal (2021)
Note: Poverty data relates to household income or consumption per person, measured in international-$ (in 2011 PPP prices) to account for
price differences across countries and inflation over time.
